channel.title: Renewable energy on Michaël Aklin
channel.description: Recent content in Renewable energy on Michaël Aklin

item.title: Two papers out
item.description: February 13, 2021 Two new papers came out in the last couple of weeks. In the first, Kern, Negre, and I examine some of the side effects of central bank independence. We suspect that governments may respond to a loss of control over monetary policy (i.e. more independent central banks) with policies that are bad for inequality. Aklin, Michaël, Andreas Kern, and Mario Negre. 2021. Does Central Bank Independence Increase Inequality?

item.title: Interview with Energy Policy Now podcast
item.description: My co-author Johannes Urpelainen and I chatted with Andy Stone who runs the Energy Policy Now podcast for the University of Pennsylvania’s Kleinman Center. You can listen to us talk about energy policy for the 2020s here.

item.title: Interview with Marketplace
item.description: I was interviewed by Marketplace on energy access and renewable energy in the world and in Sub-Saharan Africa. Interview available here.
